soen6441.kingdoms.core
Class GameState

java.lang.Object
  soen6441.kingdoms.core.GameState
All Implemented Interfaces:
MoveContext
public class GameState
extends java.lang.Object
implements MoveContext

GameState is a container for all data structure used in the game logic

           throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Setup game state to start a new epoch

Parameters:
epoch - The epoch about to start

java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if given epoch not between 1 to 3 OR if given epoch is not current epoch + 1

public boolean placePlayerTileOnBoard(int boardRow,
                                      int boardCol)
Player places its own tile onto the board. It will fail if the given board location is not empty OR if player is not holding a tile

placePlayerCastleOnBoard

public boolean placePlayerCastleOnBoard(java.lang.String castleType,
                                        int boardRow,
                                        int boardCol)
Player places its own castle onto the board. It will fail if the given board location is not empty OR if player does not have the given type of castle left

Specified by:
placePlayerCastleOnBoard in interface MoveContext
Parameters:
castleType - Castle type. One of Castle.RANK_X constant
boardRow - The index of the row where the object should be placed
boardCol - The index of the column where the object should be placed
Returns:
true if successful, false otherwise

playerDrawsNewTileFromTileStack

public boolean playerDrawsNewTileFromTileStack()
Description copied from interface: MoveContext
The player call this function to draw a new tile from tileStack immediately after placing one of its tile so that at the end of its turn he always has 3 tiles

Specified by:
playerDrawsNewTileFromTileStack in interface MoveContext
Returns:
true if the tile was drawn successfully
